name: Canada
healthcare_description: Great accessibility for all citizens. Systems struggle with efficiency and funding challenges.

name: United States
healthcare_description: Emphasis on private health insurance. Quality and efficiency vary tremendously between insurance providers.

name: Mexico
healthcare_description: Access to premium health insurance is difficult to find and afford for most citizens.

name: Costa Rica
healthcare_description: Exceptional quality compared to wealthier countries in the region. Lacks sufficient specialists and general physicians.

name: Panama
healthcare_description: Leader in Central American healthcare, though underserved regions struggle with efficiency.

name: Colombia
healthcare_description: Ranks well regionally but struggles with quality healthcare access in remote areas.

name: Peru
healthcare_description: Private healthcare is well-developed; public plans struggle with funding and accessibility.

name: Brazil
healthcare_description: One of the largest public health systems in the world, though challenged by overcrowding and underfunding.

name: Argentina
healthcare_description: Highly regarded system with vast access; public sector has limited services.

name: United Kingdom
healthcare_description: Public health system with funding challenges and workforce shortages.

name: Germany
healthcare_description: Compulsory coverage system regarded as one of the best globally.

name: Italy
healthcare_description: Highly efficient and well-ranked healthcare system with some out-of-pocket costs.

name: Norway
healthcare_description: Renowned public system with exemptions for vulnerable populations.

name: Turkey
healthcare_description: Significant advancements but rural regions face workforce shortages.

name: Nigeria
healthcare_description: Improvements made, but quality, inexpensive services are still a challenge.

name: South Africa
healthcare_description: Disparity exists between private wealthier sectors and underfunded public systems.

name: Japan
healthcare_description: Highly efficient, low-cost public healthcare system known for quality services.

name: India
healthcare_description: Underfunded public sector with disparities between rural and urban access.

name: China
healthcare_description: Reforms aim to reduce disparities and improve healthcare quality.

name: Philippines
healthcare_description: Ongoing reforms aim to improve accessibility for all Filipinos.

name: New Zealand
healthcare_description: Combines public healthcare services with optional private options.

name: Australia
healthcare_description: Medicare system ensures affordable access to essential services.
